content:
• Thursday, November 1, 2012
  • ATML

    More on Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML): Q3 comes in mixed as net earnings slumped 81% on lower revenue....

    More on Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML): Q3 comes in mixed as net earnings slumped 81% on lower revenue. However, it should be taken into account that the year-earlier period had included a gain from the sale of its former corporate headquarters. Gross margin narrowed to 43.1% from 50.1%. Shares -1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM

  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) now +9.5% AH following its Q3 beat. Q4 guidance is for EPS of $6.12-$6.57,...

    Priceline (PCLN) now +9.5% AH following its Q3 beat. Q4 guidance is for EPS of $6.12-$6.57, in-line with a $6.34 consensus and fine with investors worried about Europe and (increasingly) the U.S. Total bookings rose 25% Y/Y in Q3 - international +30%, domestic +7% - only a slight slowdown from Q2. Q4 bookings are expected to grow 21%-28% Y/Y, with 27%-35% international growth offsetting flat domestic growth. Between Priceline and TripAdvisor, online travel names such as EXPE, TZOO, OWW, and KYAK could have a good day tomorrow. (PR)

    More on Active Network's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $93M-$97M and a net loss of...

    More on Active Network's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $93M-$97M and a net loss of $13M-$18M, below a consensus of $102M and $0.02. Initial 2013 guidance is also disappointing: revenue of $470M-$480M and a net loss of $31M-$38 vs. a consensus of $502.5M and $0.32 EPS. No explanation given in PR. SA's Prescience Point made a short argument for Active yesterday that questioned its organic growth and financial statements, among many other things. ACTV -24.7% AH. (PR) (CEO resignation)

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Yelp expects Q4 revenue of $40M-$40.5M, in-line with a $40.4M...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Yelp expects Q4 revenue of $40M-$40.5M, in-line with a $40.4M consensus. 2) SunPower expects Q4 revenue of $700M-$900M and EPS of $0.00-$0.25 vs. a consensus of $799.4M and $0.11. 3) OpenTable expects Q4 revenue of $41.5M-$43.1M and EPS of $0.41-$0.45 - the latter is in-line with a $0.43 consensus, but the former misses a $43.4M consensus. YELP +0.5% AH. SPWR -3.5%. OPEN -3.9%. (Yelp PR) (SunPower PR) (OpenTable PR)

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q3 misses on the bottom line, as an 18% Y/Y jump in revenue was...

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q3 misses on the bottom line, as an 18% Y/Y jump in revenue was largely offset by offset by a lower than expected contract award fee, the impact of foreign currency losses, and a higher than anticipated effective tax rate. For the current year, the company raises the lower end of its earnings estimate by $0.10, now expecting $3.60 to $3.80 a share. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • CHK

    More on Chesapeake's (NYSE:CHK) Q3 results: Produced 4.14MMcf/day of natural gas. Oil...

    More on Chesapeake's (NYSE:CHK) Q3 results: Produced 4.14MMcf/day of natural gas. Oil production jumped 96% Y/Y, gas rose 19%, NGL up 1%; expects natural gas production to decline 7% and liquids to rise 29% in 2013. No guidance offered. But investors are rattled by $2B in impairment charges; after rising initially, shares -2.3% AH.

  • SBUX

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ4: Global comparable store sales rose 6%, with a 5% increase...

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ4: Global comparable store sales rose 6%, with a 5% increase in traffic and a 1% increase in average ticket contributing. Growth in China/Asia Pacific led regions with a 10% increase, while EMEA lagged with a 1% decline. The company grew its operating margin by 210 bps to 21.4%. Dividend payout increased to $0.21 a share, from $0.17 a share. Raises FY13 EPS estimate to $2.06-$2.15, from prior guidance of $2.04-$2.14. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)

  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4.8%) finishes higher today after saying it's entered into a...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4.8%) finishes higher today after saying it's entered into a non-exclusive agreement with GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) to conduct a Phase 2 study of an all-oral regimen for the treatment of hepatitis C containing Vertex's nucleotide analogue hepatitis C virus polymerase inhibitor VX-135 and GSK's NS5A inhibitor GSK2336805. The study is expected to begin in early 2013, pending discussions with regulatory authorities.

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +8%) moves higher after saying that an abstract of the results...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +8%) moves higher after saying that an abstract of the results from its Phase 2b clinical study examining the treatment effect of blisibimod in systemic lupus erythematosus patients has been accepted as a late-breaking poster presentation at the 2012 Annual Scientific Meeting of the American College of Rheumatology and the Association of Rheumatology Health Professionals.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC -6.9%) shares accelerate their descent after CEO Chris Crane says the utility...

    Exelon (EXC -6.9%) shares accelerate their descent after CEO Chris Crane says the utility company may cut its dividend for the first time to maintain an investment grade credit rating, which is “fundamental” to about half of EXC’s businesses. EXC’s credit is rated at the second-lowest investment grade, BBB by S&P and Baa2 by Moody’s. (earlier: Q3 earnings)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • TUP

    Tupperware (TUP +6.2%) shares hit a six-month high as Morgan Stanley upgrades the maker of...

    Tupperware (TUP +6.2%) shares hit a six-month high as Morgan Stanley upgrades the maker of storage products to Overweight, saying TUP has "the best of both worlds - high growth and cash to shareholders." With underlined emphasis, the firm says TUP is by far the most undervalued company among peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CTRX

    Catamaran (CTRX +8%) pops after its Q3 per share earnings beat estimates this morning....

    Catamaran (CTRX +8%) pops after its Q3 per share earnings beat estimates this morning. Additionally, the company announced it had beaten out Express Scripts to sign a 3-year pharmacy contract with Target (TGT -1.3%). ISI estimates the deal will be worth $100-$150M on an annual basis and notes it's CTRX's first significant entrance into the large-employer market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • GOLD

    "The market had believed all the skeletons had been taken out of the closet, so it is...

    "The market had believed all the skeletons had been taken out of the closet, so it is disconcerting that we are getting these remnant pieces of bad news," a Stifel Nicolaus analyst says on Barrick Gold's (ABX -9.4%) ugly Q3. CEO Jamie Sokalsky says ABX has its "arms around" its problems and is looking at ways to increase return on capital through shelving or deferring projects and disposing of others.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • LGCY

    Legacy Reserves (LGCY +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter after the MLP reported Q3...

    Legacy Reserves (LGCY +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter after the MLP reported Q3 results and the units traded down 4%. Distribution coverage was 0.87x, but the firm says it included growth and maintenance capex; excluding growth spending, the firm thinks the ratio was significantly greater than one. LGCY also is poised to benefit as its Wolfberry wells are brought online.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • PBH

    Prestige Brands (PBH +20.3%) ramps higher after its FQ2 easily beat across the board this...

    Prestige Brands (PBH +20.3%) ramps higher after its FQ2 easily beat across the board this morning. Net earnings rose 53% Y/Y on revenue growth of 49%. The seller of brands such as Chloraseptic sore throat treatments, Clear Eyes eye-care products and Compound W wart treatments also boosted its per-share earnings guidance, now expecting its FY13 EPS to be around $1.37 - $1.42, above the consensus of $1.34.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy (REGI +4.8%) acquires a 15M gal./year Texas multi-feedstock biorefinery for...

    Renewable Energy (REGI +4.8%) acquires a 15M gal./year Texas multi-feedstock biorefinery for $300K in cash and 900K shares of its common stock, increasing REGI's biodiesel production capacity to more than 225M gal./year. The deal brings REGI its second Texas biodiesel production facility, following the 2008 acquisition of its Houston-area plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • AAP

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP +14.3%) is halted after a CNBC report airs saying the company hired...

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP +14.3%) is halted after a CNBC report airs saying the company hired Blackstone to explore a potential sale. Peers Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +4.2%) and AutoZone (AZO +1.3%) are also getting a jolt off the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • NEWP

    Precision component maker Newport Corp. (NEWP +16.3%) jumps after its Q3 earnings beat EPS...

    Precision component maker Newport Corp. (NEWP +16.3%) jumps after its Q3 earnings beat EPS estimates late yesterday. Investors are encouraged as the company continues to deliver on the bottom line growth, despite elusive revenue. Additonally, the company also said it is ahead of schedule in its plan to achieve annualized cost savings of $15M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +11.6%) are on watch heading into the release of...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +11.6%) are on watch heading into the release of quarterly earnings for Starbucks after the bell. Today's rally is being attributed to shorts lightening their position in front of the report, although some bulls are holding out hope the SBUX numbers will show the single-serve pie is large enough for all the players to carve off a healthy slice.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • RDS.A

    As weak U.S. gas prices drag down its earnings, Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A +2.2%) plans to boost...

    As weak U.S. gas prices drag down its earnings, Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A +2.2%) plans to boost profits by converting natural gas into road fuels like diesel, which it can sell at much higher prices. Selina Williams says only Shell can leverage its position as the world’s top producer of gas-to-liquid fuels, which can fill the tank of any car, to tap profits in the U.S. fuel market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +6%) treks higher after Mount Kellett Capital, which owns 7.3% of the carrier,...

    Clearwire (CLWR +6%) treks higher after Mount Kellett Capital, which owns 7.3% of the carrier, issues a letter voicing concerns about Sprint's (S +0.8%) Eagle River share purchase, which leaves it with a majority stake and board control, and the potential for a conflict of interests. Mount Kellett wants Clearwire to "sell a substantial portion of the Company's excess spectrum," something Sprint may not be keen on doing. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • CW

    Williams Controls (WMCO +40.8%) soars after agreeing to be acquired by Curtis-Wright (CW +2.3%)...

    Williams Controls (WMCO +40.8%) soars after agreeing to be acquired by Curtis-Wright (CW +2.3%) for $119M, or $15.42/share, which represents a 41.3% premium to WMCO's Wednesday closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • VRSN

    Verisign (VRSN +10.4%) soars after providing details about an '06 amendment to a Cooperative...

    Verisign (VRSN +10.4%) soars after providing details about an '06 amendment to a Cooperative Agreement it signed with the Commerce Department. The amendment states Verisign won't renew its deal to run the .com domain name registry without the department's approval, but also states there's an "expectancy of renewal." Verisign adds it believes the DOJ has "substantially concluded its own review process" - shares had sold off on worries about the DOJ/DOC reviews. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • KWR

    Jefferies is raising its price target on Quaker Chemical (KWR -3%) to $62 from $51, following a...

    Jefferies is raising its price target on Quaker Chemical (KWR -3%) to $62 from $51, following a solid Q3 result on Tuesday. The firm says that sales trends are strong and the company delivered solid performance in spite of FX volatility and a choppy end-market. It feels KWR is well-positioned for growth next year and reiterates a Buy rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR +6.2%) rallies after announcing Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) will install 10K NCR self-checkout...

    NCR (NCR +6.2%) rallies after announcing Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) will install 10K NCR self-checkout lanes in 2013 at 1,200 U.S. stores for an undisclosed sum. The company will be providing engineering and maintenance services along with its hardware. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 4 Comments

    Photronics (PLAB -3%) slides after lowering Q4 guidance , now expecting its EPS to be $0.03 to $0.04 per share on revenue of $102M to $103M, below Street consensus estimates of $0.16 per share on revenue $116M. The firm thinks the company's longer term growth drivers remain intact and reiterates a Buy .

    Qihoo (QIHU +5.8%) rallies after CEO Zhou Hongyi tells Chinese media his company hopes to take 15%-20% of China's search market - that's well above the 9.2% share Qihoo, which launched its search engine in August, was estimated to have a month ago. Hongyi adds Qihoo has hired ex-Google employees to work on search, and wants to partner with vertical search providers. He also criticizes Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU), which just offered soft guidance, for caring more about ad monetization than the user experience. (more)

    Life Technologies Corporation (LIFE +2.3%) has received a Letter of No Objection from the USDA to develop its RapidFinder STEC, a same-day, multi-strain E. coli detection system. The RapidFinder provides meat producers a solution to detect the presence of multiple strains of E. coli in raw beef in just 10 hours, as compared to the standard six-day process established by the USDA Microbiology Laboratory Guidebook.

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS -13.8%) is off sharply in spite of beating FQ2 estimates and issuing strong FQ3 guidance (I, II). Preliminary FQ4 guidance for a 15% Q/Q revenue drop (provided in the shareholder letter) is a likely culprit. The guidance translates into revenue of $230M-$255M, above a $205.6M consensus, but expectations have grown thanks to Apple's huge orders. Also a possible concern: Cirrus says it expects its gross margin, pressured by Apple, to stay in the low 50% range "for the foreseeable future." (transcript)
